metadata.title: CVE-2022-36946 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
nfqnl_mangle in net/netfilter/nfnetlink_queue.c in the Linux kernel through5.18.14 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (panic)because, in the case of an nf_queue verdict with a one-byte nfta_payloadattribute, an skb_pull can encounter a negative skb->len.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-48.54~20.04.1
